Name: Lamp Handle of Isis
Description: The handle of a large-sized faience lamp depicts the goddess Isis, depicts the goddess Isis, the faithful wife and the kind mother. She is seated on a throne wearing Greek clothes and a crown on her head with her twisted plaits falling on her shoulders.She is shown with her son Harpocrates, also known as Horus, on her lap. She holds him with her left hand and nurses him with her right. The goddess and her son were an important decorative reference to Cleopatra and her son Caesarion.
